game

Class Monster

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Creature
      • game.Monster

  • public class Monster
extends Creature
    This class inherits from Creature.java. The methods in this class controll the AI of the monsters in the game. The methods that controll the monsters are only ran on the computer of the host.
    Author:
    magnubau and heleneyj

        A constructor for the class Monster
        Parameters:
        playerId - id of the player
        creatureId - id of the creature
        creatureName - name of the creature
        hp - health points
        ac - armor class
        movement - movement range
        damageBonus - damage bonus
        attackBonus - attack bonus
        backstory - backstory
        xPos - x-coordinate
        yPos - y-coordinate
        imageUrl - image url
        weapons - ArrayList of weapons

    • Method Detail

      • monsterMove

        public void monsterMove(java.util.ArrayList<Creature> creatures)
        Handels the movement of the Monster. If the Monster has a melee weapon, it will move towards the closest Character. If the Monster only has ranged weapons, it does not move.
        Parameters:
        creatures - ArrayList of all creatures in game

      • monsterAttack

        public void monsterAttack(java.util.ArrayList<Creature> creatures)
        Handles the attack for the Monsters. It finds the closest Character to attack. Then it finds the weapons that can be used, either ranged or melee. Finally, it picks a rendom usable weapon to attack with
        Parameters:
        creatures - ArrayList of all creatures in game

      • getClosest

        public Creature getClosest(java.util.ArrayList<Creature> creatures)
        Parameters:
        creatures - ArrayList of all creatures in game
        Returns:
        returns the Creature from the ArrayList closest to the Monster.

      • getHypotenuse

        public double getHypotenuse(int x,
                            int y)
        This method finds the hypotenuse of two integers
        Parameters:
        x - x cathetus
        y - y cathetus
        Returns:
        returns a double that is the hypotenuse of the two cathetuses x and y.

      • moveToward

        public void moveToward(Creature target,
                       java.util.ArrayList<Creature> creatures)
        Moves the Monster towards a Creature when the creature is out of range. Also makes sure Monster does not move on top of another Creature.
        Parameters:
        target - the Creature to move towards
        creatures - ArrayList of all creatures in game

      • inRange

        public boolean inRange(Creature target)
        Checks if a Creature is within the movement range of the Monster.
        Parameters:
        target - The Creature to check if is within movement range.
        Returns:
        true if target is within the movement range of the Monster, false otherwise.

      • meleeRange

        public boolean meleeRange(Creature target)
        Checks if a Ceature is in range to be attacked with a melee weapon. A Creature must be adjacent to the Monster to be within melee range.
        Parameters:
        target - The Creature to check if is within melee range.
        Returns:
        true if target is within melee range, false otherwise.

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(Creature target,
                   java.util.ArrayList<Creature> creatures)
        moves the Monster to a Creature when the Creature is within the movement range of the Monster.Also makes sure Monster does not move on top of another Creature.
        Parameters:
        target - The Creature to move to
        creatures - ArrayList of all creatures in game

      • dontStepOnOthers

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> dontStepOnOthers(int newX,
                                                               int newY,
                                                               Creature target)
        moves The monster clockwise around a Creature. Used in moveToward() and moveTo() to prevent the Monster to move on top of other creatures.
        Parameters:
        newX - x-position of Monster
        newY - y-postion of Monster
        target - the Creature to move around
        Returns:
        ArrayList with new x- and y-position

      • direction

        public int direction(int pos,
                     int targetPos)
        used to determin the direction the Monster must move. to reach the postion of another Creature.
        Parameters:
        pos - x- or y-position of Monster.
        targetPos - x- or y-position of target Creature.
        Returns:
        -1 if target - pos less than 0, 1 otherwise.

      • relativePos

        public int relativePos(int pos,
                       int targetPos)
        finds if the Monster is standing behind, next to or in front of a Creature on either the x- or y-axis.
        Parameters:
        pos - x- or y-position of Monster.
        targetPos - x- or y-position of target Creature.
        Returns:
        -1 if target - pos less than 0, 0 if target - pos == 0, 1 otherwise.

      • updateAttackPane

        public void updateAttackPane()
        Moves the attackPane to the position of the Monster.

        Returns:
        attackPane

      • initAttackPane

        public void initAttackPane(double cellWidth,
                           double cellHeight)
        Creates the attackPane of the Monster. AttackPane is a transparent red filter over all monsters that a user can click to attack it.
        Parameters:
        cellWidth - The width of the attackPane.
        cellHeight - The height of the attackPane.

      • showAttackPane

        public void showAttackPane()
        Sets the attackPane to visible.

        public void hideAttackPane()
        Sets the attackPane to invisible
